awd_titl_txt: An Evaluation of the Utilization of Robotics Technology in  Pharmacy Practice
awd_abstract_narration: 9402319  Crawford  The proposed cross-disciplinary (pharmacy and engineering)  study will examine the impact of robotics technology in  pharmacy practice.  This Planning Grant activities will  include development of a statistically based simulation  model of the unit-dose medication cart filling process fop a  hospital pharmacy department.  Activities will also include  examination of attitudes about the utilization of robotics  technology in pharmacy practice.  %%%  The PI has been trained in the field of Pharmacy  Administration, and not trained in the area of process  simulation and modeling-a  component of the planned  proposal.  A senior investigator is listed within the  planning grant with a specialty in process simulation and  modeling.  This senior investigator will serve as a mentor  to allow the PI to develop an expertise in the process  simulation and modeling within the 12 month period allotted  to the planning grant.  ***
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
